p: S. pistillata colonies from the Gulf of Aqaba, Red Sea, and B. europaea polyps from Calafuria, Ligurian Sea, north of Italy ( Fig. 1A,B), were allocated to Red Sea or Mediterranean conditions, each habitat type comprised three treatments: (1) control with ambient conditions (2) temperature −1 °C increase every three weeks (3) temperature and pH–pH 7.8 with 1 °C increase every three weeks ( Fig. 1E). Experimental duration was eight and five months according to the natural SST inclination for the Mediterranean and Red Sea corals, respectively. Coral samples were collected at intervals for RNA extraction and the maximum quantum yield (Fv/Fm) of algal symbionts was calculated as a measure of photosynthetic performance, which is considered as an indicator of thermal stress 19 20 21.
